meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.docTitle: Public Health and Municipal Services (Fees) Regulation

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Food Business Regulation (《食物業規例》) means the Food Business Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. X).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Fees in respect of hawker licences, hawker pitches or stalls
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a hawker licence, hawker pitch or stall specified in Schedule 1 is the appropriate fee specified in that Schedule.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Fees in respect of licences under Food Business Regulation
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a licence for a food business specified in Schedule 2 is the appropriate fee specified in the appropriate Part in that Schedule.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Fees in respect of permissions under Food Business Regulation
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a permission for the sale of any food specified in Schedule 3 is the appropriate fee specified in that Schedule.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Fees in respect of licences under Frozen Confections Regulation
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a licence for a frozen confection factory specified in Schedule 4 is the appropriate fee specified in the appropriate Part in that Schedule.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Fees in respect of licences under Milk Regulation
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a licence for a milk factory specified in Schedule 5 is the appropriate fee specified in the appropriate Part in that Schedule.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Fees relating to Government crematoria, columbaria or public cemeteries, etc.
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a Government crematorium, columbarium, public cemetery, garden of remembrance or the exhumation of human remains specified in Schedule 6 is the appropriate fee specified in the appropriate Part in that Schedule.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Fees in respect of licences and examination under Slaughterhouses Regulation
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a licence for a slaughterhouse and examination specified in Schedule 7 is the appropriate fee specified in Part 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Fees in respect of licences under various regulations
section.content: The fee payable for a matter relating to a licence under a regulation specified in Schedule 8 is the appropriate fee specified in that Schedule.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to Public Health and Municipal Services (Fees) (Amendment) Regulation 2025

subsection.content: The amended Regulation does not apply in relation to a specified application made before the commencement date in relation to a food business mentioned in Part 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 or 10 of Schedule 2 (subject application).
The pre-amended Regulation continues to apply in relation to the subject application as if the 2025 Amendment Regulation had not been made.

subsection.def: 2025 Amendment Regulation (《2025年修訂規例》) means the Public Health and Municipal Services (Fees) (Amendment) Regulation 2025;
amended Regulation (《經修訂規例》) means this Regulation as amended by the 2025 Amendment Regulation;
commencement date (生效日期) means 1 November 2025;
pre-amended Regulation (《原有規例》) means this Regulation as in force immediately before the commencement date;
specified application (指明申請) means an application for the grant of a full licence under section 31 of the Food Business Regulation.

schedule.name: sch0
schedule.heading: Fees Payable for Issue or Renewal of Hawker Licences or for Allocation and Use of Hawker Pitches or Stalls

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: Fees for issue or renewal of hawker licences

tr.td: Item

td.p: Fixed pitch hawker licence
1,980 per year
Itinerant hawker licence—
18,480 per year
2,100 per year
980 per year
Temporary licence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the licensee is authorized to hawk from a fixed pitch
1/12 of the sum of the amount specified in item 1 and the appropriate amount specified in Part B of this Schedule

td.p: Deputy’s permit (L.N. 84 of 2013)
One half of the fee of his principal’s licence
Duplicate copy of a licence mentioned in items 1, 2 and 3, a permit mentioned in item 4, a hawker’s badge or a pitch card (L.N. 84 of 2013)

crossHeading.inline: B. Fees for allocation and use of hawker pitches or stalls

tr.td: Item

td.p: Cooked food
26,514 per year
Light refreshment
26,514 per year
Newspaper
1,478 per year
Tradesman
1,478 per year
Bootblack (L.N. 84 of 2013)
490 per year
Barber (L.N. 84 of 2013)
490 per year

tr.td: Wall stall—

td.p: 490 per year
5,180 per year
Other classes—
2,367 per year

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exceeding 1.1 m2 but not exceeding 1.7 m2

td.p: 3,532 per year

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: exceeding 1.7 m2 but not exceeding 2.2 m2

td.p: 4,735 per year

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Fees in respect of Licences under Section 31 of Food Business Regulation

part.name: P1
part.heading: Interpretation

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule, the following expressions have the same meaning as they have in section 31 of the Food Business Regulation—
section.def: cold store (凍房);
composite food shop (綜合食物店);
factory canteen (工廠食堂);
food factory (食物製造廠);
fresh provision shop (新鮮糧食店);
full licence (正式牌照);
general restaurant (普通食肆);
light refreshment restaurant (小食食肆);
provisional licence (暫准牌照);
siu mei and lo mei shop (燒味及鹵味店);
temporary licence (臨時牌照).

part.name: P8
part.heading: Fees for Grant or Renewal of Full Licence for Fresh Provision Shop

td.p: For a fresh provision shop for the sale of food specified in any one of the following paragraphs—
(a) beef;
(b) mutton;
(c) pork;
(d) reptiles (including live reptiles);
(e) fish (including live fish);
(f) poultry (including live poultry)
For a fresh provision shop for the sale of foods specified in any 2 of the paragraphs in item 1
For a fresh provision shop for the sale of foods specified in any 3 of the paragraphs in item 1
For a fresh provision shop for the sale of foods specified in any 4 or more of the paragraphs in item 1

part.name: P11
part.heading: Fees in respect of Temporary Licences, Provisional Licences, etc.

td.p: The grant of a temporary licence for a food business mentioned in Parts 2 to 10 of this Schedule
The grant or renewal of a provisional licence for a food business mentioned in Parts 2 to 10 of this Schedule
Half of the prescribed fee for the renewal of a full licence (L.N. 162 of 2025)
Any amendment to a full licence or provisional licence for the food business mentioned in Part 10 of this Schedule
The issue of a duplicate of a temporary licence mentioned in item 1
The issue of a duplicate of a full licence or provisional licence for a food business mentioned in Parts 2 to 9 of this Schedule
The issue of a duplicate of a full licence or provisional licence for the food business mentioned in Part 10 of this Schedule

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Fees in respect of Permissions under Section 30 of Food Business Regulation

td.p: The grant or renewal of a permission for the sale of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any one of the foods specified in items 1 to 21 (other than items 17 to 19) of Schedule 2 to the Food Business Regulation

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the food specified in item 17 of Schedule 2 to the Food Business Regulation

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: one or both of the foods specified in items 18 and 19 of Schedule 2 to the Food Business Regulation

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any two or more of the foods specified in items 1 to 21 (other than items 17 to 19) of Schedule 2 to the Food Business Regulation (L.N. 158 of 2024)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: one or both of the foods specified in items 18 and 19, and any one or more of the foods specified in items 1 to 21 (other than items 17 to 19), of Schedule 2 to the Food Business Regulation (L.N. 158 of 2024)

td.p: The issue of a duplicate of a permission mentioned in item 1

schedule.name: sch4
schedule.heading: Fees in respect of Licences under Frozen Confections Regulation

part.name: P1
part.heading: Interpretation

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: full licence (正式牌照) means a licence granted under section 19 of the Frozen Confections Regulation;
provisional licence (暫准牌照) means a licence granted under section 19A of the Frozen Confections Regulation.

schedule.heading: Fees in respect of Licences under Milk Regulation

part.name: P1
part.heading: Interpretation

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: full licence (正式牌照) means a licence granted under section 16 of the Milk Regulation;
Milk Regulation (《奶業規例》) means the Milk Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AQ);
provisional licence (暫准牌照) means a licence granted under section 16A of the Milk Regulation.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Fees Relating to Government Crematoria, Columbaria or Public Cemeteries, etc.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Interpretation

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: ashes (骨灰) has the meaning given by section 3 of the Cremation and Gardens of Remembrance Regulation; (L.N. 14 of 2019)
garden of remembrance (紀念花園) means a garden of remembrance specified in Part 7 of the Fifth Schedule to the Ordinance;
Government crematorium (政府火葬場) means a Government crematorium specified in Part 5 of the Fifth Schedule to the Ordinance;

def.name: LargeNiche
def.leadIn: large niche (大型龕位) means a niche—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is located at a Government crematorium or columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is capable of holding 4 containers; (L.N. 14 of 2019)

section.def: public cemetery (公眾墳場) means a public cemetery specified in Part 1 of the Fifth Schedule to the Ordinance; (L.N. 14 of 2019)

def.name: StandardNiche
def.leadIn: standard niche (標準龕位) means a niche—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that is located at a Government crematorium or columbarium; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that is capable of holding 2 containers. (L.N. 14 of 2019)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Fees for Matters Relating to Cremation and Gardens of Remembrance Regulation

td.p: The cremation in any Government crematorium under section 9 of the Cremation and Gardens of Remembrance Regulation of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the human remains of a person aged 12 or above

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the human remains of a person aged below 12

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the skeletal remains of a person

td.p: The permanent deposit of ashes under section 13 of the Cremation and Gardens of Remembrance Regulation in a standard niche or a large niche (L.N. 14 of 2019)
The deposit of ashes for a period stipulated by the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene under section 13 of the Cremation and Gardens of Remembrance Regulation—
$120 per year
$150 per year
The deposit of an additional set of ashes in a standard niche or a large niche (L.N. 14 of 2019)

The temporary deposit of ashes at a Government crematorium after the expiry of the period allowed by the officer in charge under section 13(2) of the Cremation and Gardens of Remembrance Regulation (L.N. 14 of 2019)

The permission granted under section 14 or 21 of the Cremation and Gardens of Remembrance Regulation for the placing of each monument, commemorative tablet, inscription, receptacle for flowers or other ornament or the planting of each tree, shrub or plant of any kind in a Government crematorium or garden of remembrance

part.name: P3
part.heading: Fees for Matters Relating to Public Cemeteries Regulation

td.p: The burial of human remains (excluding skeletal remains) in any public cemetery under section 12 of the Public Cemeteries Regulation of—
The burial of skeletal remains of a person in any public cemetery under section 12 of the Public Cemeteries Regulation

part.name: P4
part.heading: Fee for Grant of Permission to Exhume Human Remains under Section 118 of Ordinance

schedule.name: sch7
schedule.heading: Fees in respect of Licences and Examination under Slaughterhouses Regulation

part.name: P1
part.heading: Interpretation

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: Slaughterhouses Regulation (《屠房規例》) means the Slaughterhouses Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. BU).

part.name: P2
part.heading: Fees in respect of Licences and Examination

td.p: The issue or renewal of a licence for the use or occupation of premises as a slaughterhouse under the Slaughterhouses Regulation for bovine animals and solipeds with the maximum number permitted to be slaughtered each day in aggregate—

The issue or renewal of a licence for the use or occupation of premises as a slaughterhouse under the Slaughterhouses Regulation for swine, goats and sheep with the maximum number permitted to be slaughtered each day in aggregate—

tr.td: Any amendment to a licence mentioned in items 1 and 2
The issue of a duplicate of a licence mentioned in items 1 and 2
Examination of each carcass or dressed carcass and offal under the Slaughterhouses Regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a bovine animal or soliped

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a swine, goat or sheep

schedule.name: sch8
schedule.heading: Fees in respect of Licences under Various Regulations

td.p: The grant or renewal of a licence for a commercial bathhouse under the Commercial Bathhouses Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. I)
The grant or renewal of a licence for a funeral parlour under the Funeral Parlours Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AD)
The grant or renewal of a licence for an offensive trade under the Offensive Trades Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. AX)
The grant or renewal of a licence for a swimming pool under the Swimming Pools Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. CA)
The grant or renewal of a licence for an undertaker of burials referred to in the Undertakers of Burials Regulation (Cap. 132 sub. leg. CB)
Any amendment to a licence mentioned in items 1 to 5
The issue of a duplicate of a licence mentioned in items 1 to 5
